item.description:
We will take a meandering and relaxing walk at the beautiful Arnold Arboretum in Jamaica Plain. This is not so much a hike as a leisurely tree-adoration, touching and sniffing walk. We'll get lost in "tree-lation." If you like and admire trees of all sorts, this place is for you. Magnificent collections of beeches, maples, cherries, rhododendrons, lilacs, corks, lindens, oaks, all sorts of conifers, crabapples, magnolias and exotics, etc.

Here are the details...

WHERE TO PARK: anywhere along the Arborway (Rt 203) and walk back to the Main Entrance, which is right after the rotary exit

WHERE TO MEET: in front of the Hunnewell Visitor Center (building right after the main gate)

HOW LONG WILL WE STAY: 3 - 4 hours; you can stay longer, especially if you bring something... like a sheet...to stretch out on underneath a shady tree

RESTROOMS: full restroom facilities in the Visitor Center only

WHAT TO BRING: plenty of water; snacks; camera; hat; wear comfy walking/hiking shoes, TICK REPELLENT

OTHER: bring all valuables with you & lock car

INFO ON ARBORETUM:

http://www.arboretum.harvard.edu/

MAP OF ARBORETUM:

http://arboretum.harvard.edu/wp-content/uploads/Basic-map-b+w.pdf

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

So, yeah, let's relax amongst the trees....

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: A Walk Amidst Beautiful Trees
